person.persName: Speed Smith Fry (Boyle County, KY, general, abuser of refugee families at Camp Nelson)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas W. Fry and Elizabeth Fry. Attended Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Graduated from Wabash College in Crawfordsville, Indiana, in 1840. Married to Mildred T. Smith in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on November 4, 1847. Married to Cynthia Fry. Father of Walker Fry, Thomas Fry, and Speed S. Fry. Admitted to the bar in 1843. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from June 9, 1846 to June 9, 1847. Merchant in Boyle County in 1850. County judge of Boyle County from 1857 to 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from October 9, 1861, to March 21, 1862. Served in the Army of the Ohio (U.S.A.) as brigadier general from March 21, 1862, to August 24, 1865. Commandant of Camp Nelson until relieved of command after turning out over 400 black women and children in November 1864.
